chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Chauncey G Weller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--random urinalysis for alcohol/drugs
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession or ingestion of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
--take all prescription medications as prescribed
--no contact with T.P. (6/23/1999)
--no physical contact with any female under the age of 18
--letter of apology to Keith Weller, per agent 
--no operation of any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license

Arresting Agency: JCPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The Court converts all unpaid costs/ fees/ assessments to civil judgment.

--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to sentence in 15CM421

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

The Court determines there to be 165 days sentence credit to be appled to 15CM421 first and then any remainder, if any to 15CF165
Consecutive to: sentence in 15CM421

[MA]Cases 15CF265 and 15CM421 called together at 8:50am
Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court, in custody with Attorney Karl E Huebner.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Counsel verify receipt of Revocation Order and warrant; no factual corrections

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Weller

On 15CM421:  The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 9  months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH

On 15CF265:  The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 4  months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to sentence in 15CM421


The Court converts all unpaid costs/ fees/ assessments to civil judgment. 
The Court determines there to be 165 days sentence credit to be appled to 15CM421 first and then any remainder, if any to 15CF165
recess: 9:11am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
with criminal case settlement and JI's

Cases 15CF265 and 15CM421 called together at 8:35am[mo]
Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

ADA Beck presents to the Court an Amended Information for Case 15CF265
--arguments given by ADA Beck
The Court grants leave of the State to file the Amended Information

Mr. Weller admits service of the Amended Information

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Case 15CF265 as Amended and Case 15CM421; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Weller

On Case 15CF265 and 15CM421: 
The Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Weller on Probation for a term of 18 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--random urinalysis for alcohol/drugs
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession or ingestion of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
--take all prescription medications as prescribed
--no contact with T.P. (6/23/1999)
--no physical contact with any female under the age of 18
--letter of apology to Keith Weller, per agent 
--no operation of any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
--On Case 15CF265: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CM421: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
The Court determines that Mr. Weller has already provided a DNA sample and does not order another be taken. 
recess: 9:00am

Cases 15CM421 and 15CF265 called together at 9:37am [mo]
Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CM421 (Initial Appearance occurs):
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The State requests that bond remain as set; the Court maintains bond

[[Off-Record: The Clerk inquires of ADA Teuber when the bond was set, as the Clerk is unable to locate in file//Atty. Huebner indicates that a bond was suggested but not set//The Clerk inquires of the amount, type and conditions suggested//The Court imposes this bond]]

The Court imposes a $1000 signature bond with the conditions:
--No Contact with T.P. dob 6/23/1999
--No physical contact with any female under the age of 18


As to Case 15CF265:
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. Huebner requests a Plea/Sentencing date for both cases.

The Court amends the Criminal Complaint by his own hand, to correct T.P.'s date of birth to 6/23/1999
recess: 9:47am 


NEXT:  As to Both Cases: Plea/Sentencing on 1/29/16 at 8:30am

Case 15CF265 called at 3:28pm [mo]
Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court, in custody with Attorney Karl Huebner.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Weller. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Mr.Weller waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

The Status Conference is to remain on the calendar as scheduled
recess: 3:33pm in Case 15CF265


Case 15CM421 called at 3:34pm; appearances are the same
Atty. Huebner indicates that he will be Public Defender appointed on this case as well
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
The Court adjourns this Hearing to the Status Conference in case 15CF265.
The Court does not impose a bond at this time.
recess
 in Case 15CM421: 3:40pm 


NEXT:  Status Conference in Case 15CF265 and Initial Appearance in Case 15CM421 on 12/4/15 at 9:00am

[MK] case called at 2:32pm. 
Defendant Chauncey G Weller in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Weller indicates that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court discloses that it spoke with Mr. Weller's parents/alleged victim at the conclusion of a sentencing hearing on an earlier, separate case; this was a limited contact.
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--no discussion of the case with Keith Weller.
recess 2:37pm. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/14/15 at 10:20am  (2) Status Conference on 11/24/15 at 9:00am.
